description: Borrowed from Japanese 道場 (dōjō, literally “place of the ways”). Doublet of dojang.

entries.meaning: (martial arts) A training facility, usually led by one or more sensei; a hall or room used for such training.
(by extension) A room or other facility used for other activities, such as meditation or software development.
(sumo) Synonym of dohyo (“the ring in which a sumo wrestling match is held”)

description: Borrowed from Japanese 泥鰌 (dojō, “pond loach”).

entries.meaning: The dojo loach, Japanese weather loach, or pond loach (Misgurnus anguillicaudatus), a freshwater fish native to East Asia.
